page.title: 12Tourism Crosthwaite 'area'
page.content: Facilities for Tourists: {Lambhowe Caravan Park}as described on page 10. {Burblethwaite Hall, Borderside, Broad {Oak and Goswick Hall}each have one static caravan and the first two also provide the Caravan Club with space for up to 5 caravans. A few self-contained flats are to let at the {Masons Arms}and there is a little Bed and Breakfast trade in private dwellings. Two hotels provide accomodation, namely{Damson Dene}and {The Hare and Hounds.}They provide good food_as does the Masons Arms. A number of dwellings have small fruit orchards, the largest fruit crop being damsons. Tourists come in Spring to view the beautiful{damson blossom,}a renowned feature of the area. In Autumn wayside stalls attract visitors selling damsons and some apples.
